channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Crypto entrepreneur Justin Sun buys $6 million banana—and plans to eat it unless Elon Musk wants to send it to space
item.description: Sun outbid six others for the iconic work.

item.title: SEC chair Gary Gensler resigns, leaves legacy of division and crypto feuds
item.description: Gensler oversaw a turbulent time for the Securities and Exchange Commission as it battled with crypto firms and Wall street.

item.title: America’s new 1%: Free-spending DINKs shelling out for a luxury lifestyle of vacations and take-out
item.description: On average, DINKs spend four times more on dining each month than other Americans ($816 vs. $215) and allocate nearly double the typical budget for va...

item.title: Piper Sandler highlights the stocks most likely to benefit from bullish market sentiment
item.description: This handful of stocks typical notches gains when market sentiment is bullish. Wall Street's current backdrop fits that criteria.

item.title: Silicon Valley billionaire warns ‘absolutely there’s a bubble’ in AI valuations: ‘Nobody would be surprised’ if OpenAI ‘disappeared next Monday’
item.description: Longtime tech executive Tom Siebel said the market is "way, way overvaluing" AI companies of all sizes, from startups to the $157 billion OpenAI.

item.title: Bluesky CEO Jay Graber says X rival is 'billionaire proof'
item.description: Bluesky CEO Jay Graber told CNBC that the social media app's open design could thwart potential acquisition efforts.

item.title: Citadel's Ken Griffin says Trump's tariffs could lead to crony capitalism
item.description: "I am gravely concerned that the rise of tariffs puts us on a slippery slope towards crony capitalism," the billionaire investor said.

item.title: The Rabbit R1 is an example of the AI industry’s “test your products in the real world” ethos
item.description: Rabbit CEO Jesse Lyu says its better to move fast and fix problems once users encounter them.

item.title: The Fed is right to be concerned about a rebound in inflation, says strategist
Salesforce and IBM lead pack as Dow industrials ring up 350-point gain
SEC Chair Gary Gensler will step down Jan. 20, make way for Trump replacement
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump has not announced his pick, but the expectation is that the next chair will be friendlier to Wall Street and cryptocurren...

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Netflix, Alphabet, Nvidia, BJ's Wholesale Club and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.

item.title: Mortgage rates inch up toward 7% ahead of the holiday season
